title: Understanding Entropy
text: Entropy is a measure of disorder or randomness in a system. When a system becomes more disordered, its entropy increases.

title: Phase Changes and Entropy
text: When a substance changes from a solid to a liquid, the molecules become more disordered. This usually results in an increase in entropy.

title: Melting Process
text: Consider what happens to the structure of ice cream as it melts. The rigid structure of the solid ice cream becomes a more fluid liquid.

title: Entropy Change in Melting
text: As the ice cream melts, the molecules move more freely, increasing the disorder of the system. This suggests a change in entropy.

title: Predicting the Sign of Entropy Change
text: Since the melting process increases disorder, the entropy change is likely to be positive.
